-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | A don't construct
--   
--   The Acme.Dont module provides a don't command, which is the opposite
--   of Haskell's built-in do. It is used exactly like the do monadic
--   construct except that, instead of executing the block it controls,
--   it... well... doesn't.
@package acme-dont
@version 1.1


-- | The Acme.Dont module provides the indispensable don't command, ported
--   from Perl.
--   
--   For more information see influential documentation:
--   <a>http://search.cpan.org/~dconway/Acme-Don-t-1.01/t.pm</a>
--   
--   Usage:
--   
--   <pre>
--   main = don't $ do
--       name &lt;- getLine
--       putStrLn $ "hello " ++ name
--   </pre>
module Acme.Dont

-- | The Acme.Dont module provides a don't command, which is the opposite
--   of Haskell's built-in do. It is used exactly like the do monadic
--   construct except that, instead of executing the block it controls,
--   it... well... doesn't.
--   
--   Regardless of the contents of the block, don't returns ().
don't :: Monad m => m a -> m ()
